description: From Middle English foundlyng, fondeyng, variants of Middle English fyndling, fyndlyng, equivalent to found +â€Ž -ling.

entries.meaning: An abandoned child, left by its parent(s), often a baby left at a convent or similar safe place.
examples: [Owl:] You heard that [our presidential candidate] is really a ant lion[?]  [Frog:] Worst part is, [his family says he was found] in a box of popcorn.  [Owl:] Ain't it worse to be a cannibal than a foundling?  [Frog:] We can say he's changed his habits! But a family tree looks bad sproutin' out of popcorn...
